subject: Re: [junit] How to Test Private Methods Inside a Class
msgSnippet: ... Reusability is not the only reason to extract things into their own classes, is it? ... Would putting it into its own class have had any negative effect?
messageBody:
Ole Ersoy wrote:

> The file loading part is in a private method, because
> the load routine is specific to the class that is
> being tested, and is therefore not useful in a utility
> library.

Reusability is not the only reason to extract things into their own
classes, is it?

> So I just wanted to put the load routine in a private
> method and test it there, then call it from the public
> method.

Would putting it into its own class have had any negative effect?


Can you show us the load routine?

Curious, Ilja
